glossary.definition: User role with access to browse catalog, enroll in courses, view content, take assessments
User role with access to create courses, manage content, view enrollments for their courses
User role with access to all courses, users, reports, and system settings within their organization
User role with access to view team progress, assign courses, view team reports
External client role with limited access to assigned courses and their own progress

business_rules: Learners can only enroll in courses they have access to (public or assigned)
Instructors can only edit courses they created or are assigned to
Admins can view and manage all courses within their organization
Managers can view progress for users in their team only
Clients can only view courses assigned to them
Course creation requires instructor or admin role
Report access requires admin or manager role
invariants: Every user must have at least one role
Role permissions are scoped to organization
Course access is determined by role and enrollment status
Report access is determined by role and data scope
edge_cases: User has multiple roles (e.g., instructor and learner)
User role changed while actively using system
Manager viewing progress for user who left organization
Client accessing course after contract expiration
user_journeys: Learner browses catalog → enrolls in course → views content → completes course → receives certificate
Instructor creates course → publishes course → views enrollments → manages content
Admin views all courses → generates reports → manages users
Manager views team dashboard → assigns courses → views team progress
acceptance_criteria_suggestions: Users can only access features allowed by their role
UI elements are hidden/shown based on user role
Reports are filtered by role and data scope
Course access is restricted based on role and enrollment
open_questions: Can users have multiple roles simultaneously?
What happens when a user's role changes?
How are permissions inherited in role hierarchies?
assumptions: Roles are defined in PeopleCloud and synced to LMS
Permission matrix is static (not configurable per organization)
Role changes take effect immediately (no caching)
